node.title: Experience Points
node.doctext:
Voting...is installed! What does this mean? How does it apply to you? How does it work? What's my middle name? All of this and more...

First of all, to vote on any given [writeup] simply click on the + or - icons to the left of the [timestamp]. You can click + or - on each writeup of a node and vote on all them at once by then clicking the [VOTE] button located below the last writeup and before the [soft-link] box. Use these votes wisely! As opposed to the [electoral college|United States version] your votes count! When a writeup gets five negative votes it will be kicked to a page that some editors will be perusing regularly, thus risking deletion by the staff. As you can see below having your writeup deleted is [a bad thing]. It will hurt your "experience points" and negatively effect your level. Conversely, if your writeups are voted + by your fellow users you will gain experience points. Details are below, in a rough-sketch of our devious little plan. You will receive a certain number of votes per 24 hour day, the higher your level the more votes you receive. Each time you use all of your votes in a given day you will receive an experience point bonus.

(my middle name is, incidentally, [William]...I was named after my grandfather)

The stuff below is still in the "maybe" stages. We sketched it out after Nate had finished a long run of [Everquest]. The titles will almost certainly change...[Suggest Level Titles For Everythingians] here!...and the XPs and number of votes may change as well.

As you can see, with each [level] gained a new "[power]" is awarded. We would like you to eventually have your own versions of Everything that you can fool around with, probably with a gateway from your home node. Image libraries, (no [porn], sorry) and the ability to [bless]/[curse] (hand out XP or take it away...a few points each day). It's gonna be [cool]. Comments? Ideas? Scornful accusations? Let us know what you think [Comments on Everything Voting|here].

One will be a webmail server for Everything. This will allow you to send/receive email to people's home nodes (mail can only be viewed by them). You've got nodes!

The "percentage chances" are another way to encourage interaction with the Everything system: Every time you vote or get voted on there is a percentage chance that your XP will increase. (decrease if you get voted negatively)

Other ways to alter [XP]:

+10 points if a writeup is "[Page of Cool|cooled]"
-5 if a writeup is "[nuked]"
20% chance of +1 every time you [vote]
33% chance of +1/-1 if your writeup is voted +/-
+1/2 number of votes cast if all votes are cast on any given day
Other Ideas:
[T-Shirts]/[Calendar]s awarded if you make [M-Noder] status...T-shirts/calendars designed by high-level noders
